snippet: The defendant told the police that he knew the victim was too drunk to pose a deadly threat and acknowledged that he could have just walked away, a prosecutor said.
abstract: Naeem Davis, charged with pushing Ki-Suck Han to his death in front of subway train in Midtown Manhattan on Dec 3, pleads not guilty to charges of murder and manslaughter.
lead_paragraph: The defendant told the police that he knew the victim was too drunk to pose a deadly threat and acknowledged that he could have just walked away, a prosecutor said.

headline.seo: Man in Fatal Subway-Pushing Case Pleads Not Guilty to Murder Charge
headline.main: Man Pleads Not Guilty to Murder in Fatal Subway Pushing
headline.print_headline: Man Pleads Not Guilty in Subway-Pushing Case
